text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new Pharrell
record girl
super producer singer and songwriter
Pharrell he only has a few albums to his
name yet he is so widely known in the
world of popular music through his
fantastic production with the Neff Tunes
and any Rd and he's also been kind of
the architect of numerous pop R&B as
well as knurl hits over the years both
minor and major and he's been doing
especially well this past year singing
and producing some pretty major songs
like blurred lines get lucky he had a
hand in Beyonce's latest record as well
as my favorite instrumental from the new
schoolboy q album and he's essentially
taking advantage of this latest success
streak with a new record that I was kind
of looking forward to once I heard the
lead single from it happy a song which
the tracklist of this record is quick to
remind us is from the Despicable Me 2
soundtrack and even though the song is
most likely one of the most feel-good
songs of the past 365 days and really
delivers on its title with some fun
lyrics as well as some awesome vocal
layering toward the back end of the
track great drumbeat but what makes this
track stick out to me the most is it is
one of the few songs on this record
where Pharrell's songwriting and singing
actually pleases me I apologize but
outside of my favorite any Rd tracks
Pharrell's vocals his singing especially
his falsetto I've never been a fan of it
I personally find his falsetto singing
to be a little too weak frail kind of
boyish and oddly enough it's something
that Pharrell has been relying on a lot
lately and it's no more appealing for me
here actually it becomes less appealing
because I'm listening to her for 40
minutes in a series of songs that are
nowhere near as good as a lot of the
hits that we've heard Pharrell appear on
lately in a nutshell for me listening to
Earl is a lot like giving a listen to
Justin Timberlake's latest full-length
LP in the 20/20 experience I actually
think the production on these two
records share a lot of the same
qualities however girl delivers hardly a
shred of lyrical class not nearly as
much extravagance or vocal ability and
even though I do find a lot of
similarities between these two albums
the only track I think would have fit on
to the 20/20 experience or at least the
20/20 experience part two snuggly and
tastefully is the opener Marilyn Monroe
the instrumentation is similarly ritzy
expensive sounding and danceable there's
strings all over this track there's a
great drum beat these soaring vocals on
the chorus it's got a strong disco vibe
and despite all these instrumental
characteristics that I'm talking about
somehow the production on here still
ends up sounding kind of plain kind of
lifeless sort of colorless it just
doesn't feel like I'm listening to real
instrumentation it sounds like I'm just
listening to thin synthesized just
gutless Ness and even though I do sense
a certain amount of variety among the
instrumentals on this LP I think girl
ends up being kind of homogenous from
the subtly African music influence track
lost Queen to the kind of reggae tinged
Alicia Keys track toward the back end of
this thing which is a favorite of mine
on this LP but really only thanks to
miss keys
Justin Timberlake actually turns up on
the second track on this LP brand-new
and the song is alright it just kind of
sounds like an off-the-wall era Michael
Jackson riaj the loop bass horn and drum
groove and for those that still think
that Pharrell is a decent singer I I ask
you listen to the song the hunter on
this record excruciating it seems like
on the surface it was going for a
legitimate disco funk vibe but the
gutless base and the strung-out guitars
and the weird drum groove on this track
leave this song feeling more like a
Delta 5 song or like a slit song or
something off of the disco not disco
compilation series where you're getting
these bands that are essentially Punk
groups but taking the sounds of disco
and kind of bastardizing them and making
weird tongue-in-cheek pop and dance
tunes and to kind of add insult to
injury on this track Pharrell just
dishes out some lyrical trash duck
dynasty's cool and all but they've got
nothing on the females call I'm a hunter
you're a hot man I'm a hunter you're a
hot guy and a hunter
you're a hunter I'm a hunter I'm a
hunter and this tasteless lyrical streak
continues on songs like gush which for
me is one of the most unsexy words you
can apply to a sexual situation and yet
it happens here and then there's come
get it BAE with Miley Cyrus we're
essentially using motorcycles as a
metaphor there are some sexual
situations being described idea free
idea free idea here Pharrell go on tour
behind this album and get a motorcycle
shaped bed or bed shaped motorcycle
whichever one you can get your hands on
for the least amount of money and then
have Miley Cyrus twerk on your face on
the bed and then ride away into the
sunset because it's also a motorcycle
unless it's just a bed shaped motorcycle
because then it's just a bed the vocal
harmonies that Miley Cyrus and Pharrell
have on this track just sound really
cheap and and fake and just so thin and
just so boring to listen to
oh and on top of it the groove the
bassline the drums on this track just
sound like a really lazy reappropriation
of like a classic New Orleans funk beat
from like a band like the meters or
something like that I could go into
nearly every track on this LP pointing
out what makes it so unappealing but the
truth is is that you know this record
doesn't really need to be appealing it's
not good it doesn't need to be good and
it doesn't need to be good because
Pharrell's bread and butter has never
been his albums
Pharrell is going to continue to
great songs I'm sure it's just that a
lot of them are not going to have his
name in front of them that's all it
doesn't make him any less important or
influential though some artists are best
on the stage and some artists work best
behind the scenes and Pharrell is one of
the few artists who has made a really
successful career out of having a foot
in both these worlds girl however is
clearly one of those moments where
Pharrell tries but both feet into the
spotlight and the end result is just
silly or really arduous listen really
lackluster songwriting production
lyricism there's a terrible song on this
record for every okay one that there is
I'm feeling a light two decent three on
this thing transition if you've given
this record to listen what did you think
of it did you love it did you hate it
did it make you happy I do like that
song this is a really good song though
[Music]
Anthony Fantana
Pharrell girl forever
